title: Inspection of register and index.
content: 108.- (1) Except when the register of members is closed under the provisions of this Law, the register, and index of the names of the members of a company shall, during business hours (subject to such reasonable restrictions as the company in general meeting may impose, so that not less than two hours in each day be allowed for inspection) be open to the inspection of any member without charge and of any other person on payment of 0,3416 euros, or such less sum as the company may prescribe, for each inspection. 6(b) of 76 of 1977. (2) Any member or other person may require a copy of the register, or of any part thereof, on payment of 0.0854 euros, or such less sum as the company may prescribe, for every hundred words or part thereof required to be copied. The company shall cause any copy so required by any person to be sent to that person within a period of ten days commencing on the day next after the day on which the requirement is received by the company. 4 of 166 of 1987. 4 of 166 of 1987. (3) If any inspection required under this section is refused or if any copy required under this section is not sent within the proper period, the company and every officer of the company who is in default shall be liable in respect of each offence to a fine not exceeding forty-two euros and further to a default fine of forty-two euros. (4) In the case of any such refusal or default, the Court may by order compel an immediate inspection of the register and index or direct that the copies required shall be sent to the persons requiring them. 102 Consequences of failure to comply with requirements as to register owing to agentâ€™s default.
